Posts.Content: Sep 15, 2011 02:44PM joynow wrote: Hi, it's hard for them. My daughter is 14, she was 8 when I was diagnosed with stage 1V from the beginning. Counseling was helpful and being open about treatment as it's just too hard to hide the reality when your living with this monster. The sad thing for me was when she would say Why can't you be normal like the other mums, just heartbreaking. She doesn't say that anymore, just worries about me leaving her. Hopefully not any time soon. I wish you well, hugs. Wendy.
Posts.Title: Reality for my teen child WifeandMom lukejessesmom

Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2010 01:27AM joynow wrote: Hi, Im an Aussie too. My oncologist has just taken me off femera after 4 years , to start taking arimidex which I will begin in a couple off weeks. She thinks it may improve my bone pain, worth a try. She did say that the femra and arimidex were very similar. I have had hot flushes, weight gain and loss of bone density and bone pain. I also have insomnia, but its amazing what you will put up with to keep this disease controlled. Im actually a little nervous about changing drugs when its still working. I also have herceptin every 3 weeks and an anual dose of zometa for osteoporosis. You just learn to live with it, hopefuly a lot longer. Cheers Wendy.

Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2010 02:05AM joynow wrote: Im in Lilydale victoria, its a really helpful site I have been lurking for a while and joined a couple of months ago. I was dx stage 4 with my initial dx in 2005. Cheers Wendy.

Posts.Title: How long since your stage 4 diagnosis? Iwillwinthisbattle harvey

Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2010 05:00AM joynow wrote: Hi, I have had great results with herceptin and femera for a large liver tumorÂ  for nearly 5 years, but the hepatic surgeon and my oncologist say its a miracle. A liver resection was on the cards for me too but only as a back up, as statistacly liver tumors dont respond well to chemo. Its a different journey for us all as the cancers behave differently for each of us. Now I have regular scans and marker tests and its controlled who knows for how long, only God. I wish you all the very best its so frightening at the beginning to know what to think and do .

Posts.Title: Lumpectomy even at stage IV??? mommyx3 MJLToday

Posts.Content: Feb 14, 2011 10:35PM joynow wrote: Hi, I have been living with liver mets for 5 years. I started out with Ac 4 cycles and taxatere 6 cycles. Then herceptin and femera, Im currently on arimidex and herceptin tumors shrunk and I have remained stable. It's not a cure but it's been an excellent treatment, I would ask for a biopsy you need all the information you can get. I hope this helps, wishing you all the best.
